meanings.definition: To assert or maintain a false claim or assertion.
meanings.sent1: He misclaims that he won the race, but everyone knows he came in last.
meanings.sent2: She misclaims ownership of the book, even though it clearly belongs to the library.
meanings.sent3: The cat misclaims that the dog stole its toy, but we all saw the cat hiding it.
meanings.sent4: The politician misclaims support from the people, but the polls tell a different story.
meanings.sent5: The student misclaims that the dog ate their homework, but the teacher found it in their bag.

meanings.definition: A false or inaccurate claim or assertion.
meanings.sent1: The misclaims made by the company led to a loss of trust among customers.
meanings.sent2: She was caught spreading misclaims about her coworker to get ahead.
meanings.sent3: The misclaims in the gossip magazine were so outrageous that no one believed them.
meanings.sent4: His misclaims about his qualifications were exposed during the job interview.
meanings.sent5: The misclaims in the advertisement misled many consumers into buying the product.
